page.title: 01GREENWICH MERIDIAN LINE
page.content: The line of longitude 0 or the Meridian Line runs quite close to the village of Comberton and this is how our school got its name. The school was built in 1969 and last year we celebrated 100 years of the Meridian Line by fixing a stone sun dial on the line where it crosses the Comberton Road between the villages of Toft and Comberton. There was also a tree planted at this point when the school opened. The Post Office flew along the Meridian Line in a helicopter and landed on the school playing field and some children were interviewed on television. We visited Greenwich Observatory and the Maritime museum and also had a first-day cover postage stamp issued from the school. These should be valuable in the future.
